Articles.Content: On my new rocket, Orbiter-2, the first stage has ten engines. Each engine has three fuel tanks above it. Now, I want all ten to go out simultaneously, but it just won\'t happen. Can someone pick it up and help me?

I believe that if you take them off your rocket and then put one back on using symmetry button it should fix the problem. Just move both the tank and engine simultaneously.

Disabling flow on the part that they are all connected to should help as well. Attaching them to a part that does not support fuel flow should also work.

I\'m at work now, so I can\'t try this on your .cradt (
It might help to note which, if any, mods your craft uses. Because I can\'t load it. Just take a screenshot of it in the VAB, it should be enough for us to see how it\'s made.

It doesn\'t use any mods... What part is missing?

Also, I fixed it.

I rigged the four extra stages up to radial decouplers, and then never fired off the decouplers. Works just fine, flies exactly like it should.

Except now the middle two stacks burn out faster than the others.

It doesn\'t use any mods... What part is missing?

Something called 'NP.radialparachute'.

Something called 'NP.radialparachute'.

That would be from the NovaPunch pack.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Hmm...

Oh yes, I was experimenting with braking chutes, my bad. Lemme fix that...

And, I solved the fuel issues. Thanks for the help!
